fields.summary: Studio preferences > titanium General - an error is shown if desktop sdk is not installed (may no longer be appropriate and cause unnecessary alarm)

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Appcelerator running on Windows 7 (64-bit)
When you set the 'Titanium SDK Home' = 'C:\Users\<my user>\AppData\Roaming\Titanium'
The Appcelerator complains that 
'.....AppData\Roaming\Titanium\sdk\win32' is not a directory.

Under the set directory, there are only mobilesdk & modules sub-directories, but not the sdk the error is referring to.
When you change mobilesdk to sdk and restart the application. No error is reported in the
Window->Preferences setting. But the system detect missing mobilesdk and proceed to
recreate the missing mobilesdk directory.

Its seems that the path in error checking and sdk directory update are not in sync.


http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10556575/how-to-locate-titanium-mobile-sdk-in-titanium-studio
http://developer.appcelerator.com/question/129786/could-not-locate-a-titanium-desktop-sdk-at-the-given-path

h3. Actual Result
see above.

h3. Expected Result
Both the error checking path and sdk update should be referring to the same path?
fields.summary: Window->Preference -> Titanium SDK Home setting problem
